physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was found hypertriglyceridemic with a triglyceride level of 25.9 mmol/liter (normal range: 0.5–2.0 mmol/liter) and extremely low levels of LDL-C (0.84 mmol/liter, normal range: 2.0–4.2 mmol/liter) and HDL-C (0.20 mmol/liter, normal range: 1.05–1.8 mmol/liter). LPL activity was consistently decreased, with some measurements indicating severe deficiency.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's LPL activity varied over time but was consistently decreased. The introduction of immunosuppressive treatment (azathioprine) resulted in a 40% decrease in plasma triglyceride concentrations, suggesting improvement.
